intro: Dumasia villosa var. leiocarpa, commonly known as the silky dumasia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, velvety appearance. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, often clustered in racemes. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks.
